intro: Bowdichia racemosa, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that appear in clusters during the dry season. The tree has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces long, cylindrical pods that contain flat, seed-like structures. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant also plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
